concept_definition: The action or skill of interpreting written or printed language; an instance of reading (e.g., a public reading of a text).
The activity or process of producing text by using a pen, pencil, keyboard, or other tool; the result produced (text) when someone writes.
the act or process of producing a picture or diagram by making lines and marks, especially with a pen, pencil, or charcoal, on paper or another surface; also, a picture or sketch produced in this way
The art or practice of applying pigment, paint, or other medium to a surface (such as canvas, paper, or walls) to create an image, design, or decoration; a work of art produced by this process.
The activity or art of producing musical sounds with the voice; the act of performing a song.
The activity or art of moving the body rhythmically to music, typically for expression, social interaction, or performance.
The activity or process of preparing food by heating, mixing, and combining ingredients to make meals.
The process or art of cooking food by dry heat, especially in an oven; the action or practice of making baked goods such as bread, cakes, cookies, and pastries.
The activity or practice of cultivating and tending a garden, including planting, watering, pruning, and caring for plants.
The activity or occupation of catching fish, either for food or sport, using rods, nets, traps, or other equipment.
The activity of going for long walks, especially across country or on trails, as a recreational or fitness activity.
The activity of staying outdoors in a tent or other temporary shelter for recreation or survival, often involving cooking over a campfire and sleeping overnight.
The act or process of going from one place to another, typically over a distance; journeys or trips taken for pleasure, business, or other purposes.
The art, process, or practice of producing durable images by recording light electronically (with a digital sensor) or chemically (on photographic film).
organized physical or competitive activities, such as football, basketball, or tennis, that involve skill, physical effort, and often rules and competition between individuals or teams.
organized sound or sequences of tones and rhythms created or performed to express ideas, emotions, or for aesthetic enjoyment; the art or science of combining vocal or instrumental sounds.
Feature-length or short films shown in cinemas or distributed for viewing on television or streaming platforms.
organized activities with rules, played for amusement, competition, or training; examples include board games, video games, and sports.
the element of a person that thinks, perceives, feels, and wills; the conscious mental processes or intellect
a thought, plan, or suggestion about what to do or how to do something; a mental representation or concept
the process or product of thinking; an idea, opinion, or mental consideration formed in the mind
a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, typically separated by spaces in writing and by pauses in speech, used to convey meaning or form sentences
a system of words, symbols, or signs used by a community for communication and expression, including spoken, written, and signed forms

the sound produced by a person or animal using the vocal cords; the power or range of this sound (e.g., a singing voice); a means of expressing opinions or feelings (e.g., giving someone a voice in decisions); the distinctive style or tone in which something is written or spoken
a sentence or phrase used to ask for information, request an answer, or express doubt
a spoken or written reply to a question, request, or statement; a solution to a problem or explanation resolving a question
a cause or explanation for an action, event, or belief; a basis for deciding or believing something
the quality or state of being in accordance with fact or reality; a statement or belief that accurately reflects the way things actually are

(1) An account of events or experiences, either true or fictitious, told or written for entertainment or information. (2) A report of past events or a narrative of events in someoneâ€™s life. (3) A level or floor of a building (e.g., "a three-story building").
a representative instance or model used to illustrate or explain a general rule, concept, or method; something chosen to show what other similar things are like

a faculty by which stimuli from outside or inside the body are perceived (e.g., sight, hearing, touch); a feeling or perception produced in the mind by something external or internal; practical awareness or understanding of a situation or fact (e.g., a sense of urgency).
a subjective experience of emotion, sensation, or intuition; an awareness of a physical or emotional state (e.g., a feeling of joy, a feeling of pressure in the chest).
Facts, data, or knowledge provided or learned about something; communications or signals that convey meaning and reduce uncertainty.
newly received or noteworthy information about recent events, especially as reported by media outlets; reports or announcements of recent events or developments
a matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with; a question or exercise requiring a solution
The group of people and institutions that make and enforce laws, policies, and decisions for a political unit (such as a country, state, or city).
A system of rules established by a government or other authority to regulate behavior, enforceable by penalties; a statute, regulation, or body of rules governing a community.
A community of people living together in an organized way and sharing laws, institutions, traditions, and culture; the aggregate of individuals and groups forming a structured social system.
the members of the community at large; the people as a whole (e.g., "He spoke to the public about the policy").
If intended as a noun (rare): "social: an organized gathering of people for pleasure, conversation, or networking."
Relating to the government, public affairs, or the conduct and organization of power and policies within a society; concerned with politics.
international (noun): an organization, event, or agreement involving two or more countries; a person who represents or competes for multiple countries (e.g., an international in sports contexts).
a person who is a citizen or subject of a particular nation or country
An organization or activity engaged in the production, purchase, or sale of goods or services for profit; commercial, industrial, or professional activity.
a business organization that produces goods or provides services, especially one that is legally registered
a medium of exchange in the form of coins, banknotes, or digital balances accepted as payment for goods and services and as a measure and store of value
the action of helping or doing work for someone; an act or system that provides a public benefit or commercial assistance (e.g., customer service, postal service, repair service)
The activity of buying, selling, or exchanging goods and services, especially on a large scale or between regions or countries.
An organized, prolonged conflict between states, societies, or groups, typically involving armed forces and sustained military operations.
a state or condition in which there is no war, conflict, or fighting; a period of tranquility, harmony, or quiet among individuals, groups, or nations
the armed forces of a country collectively, including its army, navy, air force, and other service branches
a large organized group of soldiers trained for land warfare, typically commanded by a national government
the branch of a nation's armed forces that conducts military operations at sea
A strong feeling of deep affection, attachment, or care for another person, animal, or thing; a profound emotional bond often involving desire for the other's well-being.
an intense dislike or aversion toward a person, group, thing, or idea
A series of thoughts, images, or emotions occurring in a person's mind during sleep; an imagined sequence of events or aspirations for the future.
An unpleasant emotional state caused by the belief that someone or something is dangerous, likely to cause pain or a threat; a feeling of anxiety or apprehension about a real or imagined danger.
a feeling of expectation and desire for a certain thing to happen; the belief that something good may occur in the future
success or good fortune that happens by chance rather than through one's own actions; the apparent cause of events beyond a person's control (e.g., "She had the luck to find a job quickly").
The act or process of solving a problem
information, understanding, or awareness gained through experience, education, or investigation

the ability or capacity to do something or act in a particular way; physical strength or force; the capacity to control or influence others or events; in physics, the rate at which work is done or energy is transferred (measured in watts).
the idea or significance that is intended, expressed, or implied; the sense or import of a word, sentence, action, or symbol
time (noun)
a method, style, or manner of doing something
an object, entity, or matter of concern
the final part or conclusion of something
existence; a living creature or entity
a direction or route taken; a series of lessons or lectures
one of two equal parts of something
a word or set of words by which someone or something is known
supernatural power or mysterious quality
vibrations that travel through air and can be heard
a period of relaxation or sleep; the remainder
a piece or segment of something
the physical structure of a person or animal
a dark area produced by an object blocking light
a fight or conflict between armed forces
a particular spot, moment, or detail
a subject or situation under consideration; physical substance
something known or proven to be true
complete absence of sound
absence of light
a continuous area or expanse; the universe beyond Earth
profound immorality or wickedness
a possibility or probability of something happening
the ability to see; something seen or worth seeing
difficulty, problems, or distress
the power to influence or direct behavior
a mathematical value or quantity
uncertainty or lack of conviction
a main division of a book
an act of traveling from one place to another
a category of things with common characteristics
attention or concern for someone or something
physical power or mental resilience
power or energy as an attribute of action
notice taken of someone or something
an instance or example of something; a container
the amount of space between two points
the possibility of harm or injury
a number or amount; the shape of a person's body
an activity engaged in for entertainment
the ability to remember; something remembered
an act of lifting and setting down the foot; a stage in a process
arrangement or sequence; a command
the visible shape or configuration of something
an authoritative order or instruction
a set of connected things or parts forming a complex whole
the rate at which something moves
the quality of something perceived by the nose
an agreement or arrangement
a communication sent from one person to another
a course along which something moves
a position on a scale of quantity or quality
the reason for which something is done
a number of people or things gathered together
a paid position of employment; a task
the power or right to give orders
an aggressive action against someone
a sound, especially loud or unpleasant
a social gathering; a political group
a detailed proposal for achieving something
natural aptitude or skill
the measurement of something from end to end
the ability to see something; an opinion
a person's essential being
the expression of thoughts through spoken words
a facial expression of pleasure
a form of words used as a magical charm
all existing matter and space
a competition of speed; a group of people sharing common descent
a brief written record; a musical tone
a musical composition with words
an examination or trial
an advisory or legislative body
an act of selecting between alternatives
the relative extent of something
an account of something observed or investigated
a portion of something
the process of doing something
a prescribed guide for conduct
the actual application or exercise of an idea
the measure of how heavy something is
a powerful stroke with the hand or weapon
the action of teaching a skill
the quality of being hot
an act of changing position
death, destruction, or terrible fate
a place where someone or something is located
continuous force exerted on something
the action of flying; an act of fleeing
a story, especially fictional
a large number of people gathered together
the state of the atmosphere
a way in which something is done
the state of wanting to know about something
matter or material
a repeated decorative design
a change that results from an action
a situation involving exposure to danger
two individuals together
a vigorous attempt
a group of ships or vehicles
a group of twelve
a person who receives guests; a large number
the force that attracts objects toward each other
practical contact with events or facts
a conclusion reached after consideration
a measure or frequency of something
the physical world and its phenomena
a topic or theme
a set of circumstances
serious danger
a sudden burst of light
the action of moving
a responsibility or accusation; a rush forward
the quality of a sound; a general character
a large body of matter
the state of being present
the ability to see; an imagined scene
the fact of no longer having something
the origin of something
a planned series of events
the development of events beyond control
a statement alerting to danger
the foundation or starting point
the property of reflecting light in a particular way
